Wisdom: الْبُخْلُ بِإِخْرَاجِ مَا افْتَرَضَهُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ مِنَ الْأَمْوَالِ أَقْبَحُ الْبُخْلِ
enWisdom: Stinginess in spending from one’s wealth that which Allah, the Glorified, has made obligatory, is the worst type of stinginess

Wisdom: أَقْبَحُ الْبُخْلِ مَنْعُ الْأَمْوَالِ مِنْ مُسْتَحَقِّهَا
enWisdom: The worst stinginess is withholding money from those who deserve it
The most miserly with his possessions is the most generous with his honour

Wisdom: أَبْخَلُ النَّاسِ مَنْ بَخِلَ عَلَى نَفْسِهِ بِمَالِهِ وَخَلَّفَهُ لِوُرَّاثِهِ
enWisdom: The most miserly of all people is the one who is stingy to himself with his wealth, and [eventually] leaves it behind for his heirs
